intro: Halenia adpressa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved halenia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or stream sides. Halenia adpressa is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
